Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2013 12:30PM gildedcage wrote: This is such a personal decision based on so many factors: cancer profile, feelings about body issue, how much risk one feels like living with, etc. For me, a mastectomy was the thing I feared the most. I always liked my breasts and the idea of seeing them go was really difficult for me. I was lucky that lumpectomy was an option. I was amazed that my breast looked completely normal after surgery. I was scared to take off that final bandage. I've got a scar but I'm completely ok with that. I was hoping I could eek by with only surgery and radiation but it turns out that there may be some microinvasion and I have a high Oncotype score so now I'm doing chemo too. I've talked with a few women who chose mastectomy over lumpectomy and they had good reasons for doing so: young children they need to live for, lack of attachment to their breasts or a really serious cancer diagnosis. I don't think there is any right or wrong on this one. Just take some time with it and the answer wil come.
